content.description: A researcher studying koi fish collected data on three variables, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The following residual plots show the residual for a model for predicting each variable from the age of the fish.
content.question: A conclusion that a linear model between the variable and age is appropriate is supported by which plot or plots?

choices.label: The plot for variable <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> only
The plot for variable <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> only
The plot for variable <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> only
The plots for variables <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
The plots for variables <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: The plot for variable <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> only

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
